title: Creamy Leftover Turkey and Wild Rice Soup
directions: Add 4 cups of water, butter and 1/2 tsp of salt to a large saucepan over medium-high heat and bring to a boil. Add rice and bring back to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover and cook for 55 minutes or until the rice is tender. Drain and set aside.
Cook bacon in a large Dutch oven or stockpot over medium heat for 7-8 minutes or until crisp. Remove bacon and drain on a paper towel. Chop and set aside.
Reserve bacon drippings in the Dutch oven and add onion, carrots, and celery. Sauté for 4-5 minutes, or until tender. Add garlic, sauté for 1 minute, or until fragrant.
Add 1/2 tsp salt, pepper, chicken broth, and turkey. Bring to a boil, cover, reduce heat to low and simmer for 5 minutes or until thoroughly heated.
Add rice, bacon, and cream. Increase heat to medium and cook 15 minutes or until the soup has slightly thickened.
Remove from the heat, add parsley and serve.
ingredients: 1 cup onion chopped, about 1/2 medium size onion
3 cups cooked turkey chopped, may substitute chicken
